711430f-a.text:
East 18th Street, at adjoining and east of N. E. corner of First Avenue. The Avenue is at the left and it is not shown.

July 19, 1939

P.L. Sperr

707528f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from East 18th to 19th Streets. Shown at the latter point is a station of the 2nd Avenue "g)" line. The Gramercy Theatre is a local movie house. Overhead is a gasholder of the Consolidated Edison Company. This is one of those
located in the 20th to 22nd Street area.
Incidentally this ares was the scene of one of the bloody frays attending the Draft Riots of the Civil War. Details of this
are to be found in Dennis Lynch's "Boss Tweed."
July 19, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707528f-b.text:

711427f-a.text:
349 to 335 East 18th Street, north side, west of First Ave., showing the Childrens Home and Shelter at No. 349-347.

September 1937.

George D. Chinn.

711428f-a.text:
330 to 326 East 18th Street, South Side, between First and Second Avenues, showing three small houses of a type that is fast disappearing. Note the gardens to the front of same.

February 5, 1938

George D. Chinn
NO REPRODUCTIONS
